name: sweetsop
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a round or heart-shaped tropical fruit with sweet white flesh, many black seeds and a hard green skin divided into many small sections, or the tree on which this fruit grows. It is a type of custard apple: The sweetsop, also known as sugar apple, is native to the West Indies and South America. The local name for the Sugar-apple Tree (Annona squamosa) is Sweetsop.
More examplesFewer examplesMartin, a local farmer, handed me a sweetsop, also known as a sugar apple, that looks like a pine cone and tastes like custard.A survey revealed that people with PSP-like illnesses were more likely than others to have consumed two native fruits called sweetsop and soursop.The sweetsop is a knobbly green fruit which is approximately the size of a tennis ball.
